greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of zeros in A103542(n) (binary equivalent of A102370(n)).
link: David Applegate, Benoit Cloitre, Philippe Deléham and N. J. A. Sloane, Sloping binary numbers: a new sequence related to the binary numbers [pdf, ps].
example: The sequence has a natural decomposition into blocks (see the paper): 1; 0; 1, 1, 2; 0, 2, 2, 3, 1, 1, 1; 2, 1, 3, 3, 4, 2, 2, 2, 3, 0, 2, 2, 3, 1, 1; 1, 3, ...
maple: A023416 := proc(n) local digs : digs := convert(n,base,2) : if nops(digs) = 0 then 1: else add(1-j,j=digs) : fi : end: ili := readline("b102370.txt") : while ili <> 0 do na := sscanf(ili,"%d %d") : na := A023416(op(2,na)) ; printf("%d, ",na) ; ili := readline("b102370.txt") : od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2007
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 31 2005
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2007
